comments.text:
Created attachment 569535
Testcase

Our testing of selection rendering is pretty poor at the moment --
we fail even the simplest cases (see attached test).

I think fuzz testing can help here:
1. run fuzz testing for while
2. take a screenshot of the window (ala reftest)
3a. store all ranges of the Selection in a temp array,
    Selection.removeAllRanges(), then addRange all the ranges again
-or-
3b. alternatively, reframe document.body
4. take a new screenshot => it should be the same as in 2

Step 1 shouldn't be too long I think, favoring to take screenshots often.
Fuzz test parameters should give a high degree of DOM mutations and some
Range/Selection method calls, and some contenteditable stuff too - with
spell checking enabled.

What do you think?
